instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
Out of a 2017 MBP. No history on board.

U7650 and surrounding does show some signs that someone before me had attempted some repair.

PPBUS_G3H - 13.04V
PP3V3_G3H - 3.4
PPDCIN_G3H - 0


Suggestions on where to start?

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
Really no voltage at R7020, with charger alone?
How do you get PPBUS_G3H then?
Strange to have 13V from battery alone.

If is the case, disconnect the battery, work with the board alone on the desk.

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
R7020 - 0v 
PPBUS_G3H - 13.04

This is with board out , no battery attached.

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H comes from R7020; if no battery present.
There must be at least 5V!!!
Please get a better test point for PPDCIN_G3H; just to confirm.

We cannot help if you do not provide accurate information.

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
Sigh. My voltmeter took a dump. Haha. New voltmeter in hand.

New readings 
PPBUS_G3H - 13.0v
PPDCIN_G3H - 20.3v

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
Please, put a bit more effort.
Check coils voltage.
What about 3V3_S5/SUS?
We discussed so many times about power on sequence (on the forum); which signals did you check???

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
PP3V3_S5 - 0
PP3V3_SUS - 0
PP5V_S5 - 8.5V

My apologies. Not really used to the newer stuff. Power alias a tad confusing

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H - 13.04v
PPDCIN_G3H - 20.3v
PP5V_S5 - 8.5v
PP3V3_G3H - 3.4v
PP3V3_S5 - 0v
PP1V8_S3 - 0v
pp3v3_sus - 0v
Buf_smc_reset_l - 3.4v
smc_pm_g2_en - 3.4v
PPBUS_PMIC - 13.03v
PP3V3_LDO3V - 3.19v
PMIC_SHUTDOWN_L - 3.16v

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
"PP5V_S5 - 8.5V"
This is really strange, change U7650.
Post diode mode to ground at L7670/90.

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message: Will do. I will update tomorrow.

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
I am at a bit of a loss. Before replacing u7650 today I powered on the board to do some more tests quick. 

Next thing you know I smell electrical and it appears U7800 fried. No idea why. Anyways, PPBUS_G3H is now gone and short to ground. Can this BGA chip even be replaced?

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message:
Can be changed, of course.
Pay atention, do not stress the board too much (with heat).

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message: I did some searching and could not find that chip available. At least in the united states.

threads.title: 840-00840-a No Power
threads.message: Buy scrap boards from Aliexpress, is the best option to make stock.
